conclusion: Analyze the forces acting on sliders A and B on the inclined plane to determine the magnitude of the external force F.
Slider A has gravitational force mg downward, normal force NA perpendicular, tension T along the rope, and frictional force fA opposing motion.
Slider B has gravitational force mg downward, normal force NB perpendicular, tension T along the rope, frictional force fB opposing motion, and applied force F horizontally.
Resolve forces for Slider A along the inclined plane: T - mg sin 37° - fA = 0 and fA = 0.5 NA.
Calculate fA using NA = mg cos 37°: fA = 0.5 mg cos 37°.
Resolve forces for Slider A perpendicular to the inclined plane: NA = mg cos 37°.
Resolve forces for Slider B along the inclined plane: F cos 37° - T - mg sin 37° - fB = 0 and fB = 0.5 NB.
Calculate fB using NB = mg cos 37°: fB = 0.5 mg cos 37°.
Resolve forces for Slider B perpendicular to the inclined plane: NB = mg cos 37°.
Combine equations for equilibrium since T is the same for both sliders.
Solve for T from Slider A: T = mg sin 37° + 0.5 mg cos 37° = 1.0 mg.
Solve for F from Slider B: F cos 37° = 1.0 mg + mg sin 37° + 0.5 mg cos 37°.
Calculate F: F cos 37° = mg (1.0 + 0.6 + 0.4) = mg × 2.0.
